title: Melinda Messenger drops out of panto role as 'family situation' makes it 'impossible'
text:

Melinda Messenger says she's had to pull out of her pantomime role for "personal family" reasons.

The former glamour model was due to star as Fairy Stardust in panto Robin Hood at the New Theatre Royal in Lincoln.

But a personal situation has made it "impossible" for her to perform.

Sharing a picture of herself in her festive costume, the 48-year-old wrote on Instagram : "So sad that I won't be donning my fairy wings @ntrlincoln this year due to a personal family situation which came to a head end of September and which has made it impossible for me to appear.

(Image: mirror.co.uk)

"I had to let Mike and Natalie from the theatre know three weeks ago and I’m grateful for their understanding... they know family must come first... sending all my love and best wishes though to them and the rest of the cast and crew for a magical festive season! Hope to see you there soon!"

Her fans were very understanding.

One told her: "Family should always come first no matter what..... good on you for making the right decision.... sending loads of love and positive thoughts"

Another commented: "Family always come first. Hope everything is ok"

(Image: mirror.co.uk)

Back in August, Melinda excitedly shared a picture of herself posing up in her costume for the first time.

"Fairy time," she said as she stood proudly next to her co-star Barney Harwood.

Earlier this year, Melinda split from boyfriend Chris Harding, who she'd met on TV show First Dates.

(Image: Hewitt / SplashNews.com)

She opened up about life as a singleton during an appearance on Good Morning Britain, where she took part in a debate about dating apps.

She said: "I'm not on any of them, I think there's nothing wrong with them, but it would just be awkward because if you were just known or recognisable you're going to attract the wrong kind of people."
